text: On a related question, considering I am publishing the site to github pages, how can I add a README.md and a LICENSE that would be pulled to the github pages repo? As I understand it, README.md, at least, will be processed to a `/README/index.html`, so it won’t work, right?

elements.text: On a related question, considering I am publishing the site to github pages, how can I add a README.md and a LICENSE that would be pulled to the github pages repo? As I understand it, README.md, at least, will be processed to a

text:
no, README, LICENSE etc are ignored (and you can extend the list of ignored): <https://github.com/tlienart/Franklin.jl/blob/f45e1ce5dd5634886c294ceefa90ba1666d76a3a/src/utils/paths.jl#L14>

To extend it you do in `config.md` something like `@def ignore = [files and dirs you want to ignore on top of the defaults]` so for instance `@def ignore = ["path/to/file.md", "path/to/dir/"]`

elements.text: no, README, LICENSE etc are ignored (and you can extend the list of ignored):

text:
Maybe just tell me explicitly (with addresses) where you want stuff to be at the end.

At the moment `README.md` and `LICENSE.md` will be ignored by Franklin but they'll still be available in the repo of course! it seems to me to not be super useful to copy them in the `__site/` folder unless you really want people to be able to do `<yourwebsite>/README.md` ?

text:
It is not a big deal, and I can copy it manually, but it seems natural to me, since `<https://github.com/rmsrosa/rmsrosa.github.io>` is a repo, to have a README as well.

So, my idea is to have two different READMEs,  one `README.md` in the root of the webpage generator repository `<https://github.com/rmsrosa/WebsiteGen>` and a different `README.md` inside the `website/` folder of the generator repository which would be transferred as is to `__site` and end up in the root of `<https://github.com/rmsrosa/rmsrosa.github.io>` .

Maybe this can be achieved with these `hfun_??` functions, but I had not looked at them yet and don’t know how they work. If you tell me there is a way to do it with `hfun_??` , then I can look at it more carefully.

text:
I'm a bit confused by why / what but doesn't matter, yes a `hfun_` can do this (well it's Julia code so you can do anything).

Here's a pointer: <https://franklinjl.org/syntax/utils/> so you can just write the Julia code which copies your file around to the right location :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Wonderful, it is just what I needed and I ended up learning `hfun_`. All perfect, now, at least concerning my site. I hope you figure out the strange behavior with the `research.md`. I will have another look and I will let you know if I find something. Thank you again for your prompt help and for your wonderful package!
